intro: Lonchostylis, commonly known as the yellow orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, particularly Southeast Asia. The plants are characterized by their showy, fragrant flowers that often display vivid yellow or orange hues. They typically grow as epiphytes or lithophytes, attaching themselves to trees or rocks. The botanical features of Lonchostylis include complex inflorescences and specialized pollination mechanisms adapted to their natural habitats.
